summary: This document is an email chain from November 2020 discussing the technical processing and transfer of hard drives containing productions (likely evidence) for the case US v. Epstein. The correspondence involves coordination between individuals regarding the stamping, exporting, and delivery of data from a Relativity database.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Mentioned as the judge to whom an extension request is being planned regarding the production timeline in the Epstein case.

events.title: Discussed Production Deadline
events.description: A previously discussed deadline for the production of case materials, with the team planning to request an extension from Judge Nathan.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain concerning the technical processing and physical transfer of hard drives containing evidence productions for 'US v. Epstein'.
A vendor was stamping and exporting data from a Relativity database, having broken the production into seven parts, with parts 1-3 completed and part 4 in progress as of November 4, 2020.
The correspondence indicates planning to request an extension from Judge Nathan for the production deadline, which was previously set for November 19, 2020.
Multiple email addresses and names are redacted in the text, indicating the involvement of several individuals in the evidence handling process whose identities are not disclosed.
